path: answers-db/books/Topology Without Tears/3. Limit Points/3.1 Limit Points and Closure/5/(i)

attr.q: If p is a limit point of the set S, verify that p is also a limit point of the set T.
attr.a:
For all open set U containing p, U intersects with S.
S is subset of T so U intersects with T as well.
By definition, p becomes limit point of T.
